meanings.definition: A verbal adjective in Latin that expresses necessity or obligation.
meanings.sent1: In Latin class, we learned about the gerundive and its unique role as a verbal adjective.
meanings.sent2: The gerundive in Latin helps convey the sense of obligation in certain sentences.
meanings.sent3: The gerundive seemed to be the superhero of Latin grammar, always swooping in to express necessity.
meanings.sent4: The gerundive was like a beacon of duty, shining brightly in the midst of complex sentences.
meanings.sent5: When I think of the gerundive, I imagine a signpost pointing towards what must be done.

meanings.definition: A form of a verb that functions as an adjective in English.
meanings.sent1: Learning about the gerundive in English class helped me understand its unique role as a verb-adjective.
meanings.sent2: The gerundive in English sentences can add descriptive details to nouns.
meanings.sent3: The gerundive was like a chameleon, blending seamlessly into the sentence as both a verb and an adjective.
meanings.sent4: Using the gerundive in writing is like adding a splash of color to a black-and-white picture.
meanings.sent5: The gerundive danced gracefully between verb and adjective, adding depth to the sentence structure.
